title: How to find the factors of: (2x^3 + x - 3) - Quora

response.answer_text: Given expression is 2x^3+x-3.It is easy to check that x-1 is a factor of this expression.For x=1,2x^3+x-3=2(1)^3+1-3=0.Thus x-1 is a factor of 2x^3+x-3.2x^3+x-3=2x^3-2x^2+2x^2-2x+3x-3                =2x^2(x-1)+2x(x-1)+3(x-1)                =(x-1)(2x^2+2x+3)2x^2+2x+3>0 for all real x.
